#Text=Eastern Dominican Republic
#Text=The Eastern Region is a region of Dominican Republic .
#Text=It has plain landscape of sugarcane plantations , and the world-famous beaches and resorts at Casa de Campo , Punta Cana , Cap Cana and Bavaro .
#Text=Regions
#Text=Punta Cana
#Text=Cities
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=Cap Cana
#Text=Casa de Campo
#Text=Saona Island
#Text=Los Haitises
#Text=Understand
#Text=The most important tourist destinations in the Eastern Region of the Dominican Republic are the beaches of Punta Cana and Bavaro .
#Text=These two beaches are filled with all-inclusive hotels , very popular among Europeans and North Americans .
#Text=All these hotels are very safe and are a showcase of Dominican hospitality .

#Text=For those seeking to escape the rather artificial paradise of Punta Cana and Bavaro , the closest town where tourists can witness the Dominican reality is that of Higüey , the religious center of the country .
#Text=The " Basilica de Higüey " is the scene of intense local pilgrimage every January .

#Text=To the South , you will find the city of La Romana , contiguous to the world-famous resort of Casa de Campo , where the rich and wealthy of the Dominican Republic and the world have their beach residences .
#Text=Casa de Campo has the country 's best golf courses , as well as a beautiful and fancy Marina , smaller than that of Cap Cana .

#Text=Tourists should not miss the tourist town of Altos de Chavón , the replica of a Renaissance Italian village , home to one of the Caribbean 's most important art schools , overlooking a cliff and the Chavón River .
#Text=Its replica of a Roman Amphitheater is the scene of multiple shows and concerts .
#Text=Close to La Romana is the beach of Bayahibe , another alternative to Punta Cana .

#Text=Also , those who are looking for infinite white-sand beaches but hate huge hotels and resorts can explore the Saona Island off the southeastern coast , offering the same natural beauty of Punta Cana , but undefiled by mass tourism .
#Text=Destinations off the beaten path include first the chaotic town of San Pedro de Macoris , home to the most famous Dominican baseball players such as Sammy Sosa and Pedro Martinez .
#Text=The town is surrounded by " Bateys " or sugar-cane plantations , offering a stark contrast with the resorts .

#Text=To the North , you will find the beach of Miches , which the locals have made impressive efforts to develop on their own , providing for an alternative more authentic tourist destination without any of the fancy all-inclusive resorts that plague the East Coast .
#Text=Miches is close to Los Haitises National Park .
#Text=The park has an outstanding natural beauty , displaying a beautiful tropical rain-forest , and an unending chains archipelagos that are readily explorable by boat .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Punta Cana International Airport
#Text=Airport of La Romana
